critique: This document primarily concerns aeronautics research and development policy. It aims to facilitate progress in this field through government funding and cooperation with various entities. It emphasizes technological leadership, innovation, and coordination among government agencies. The order assigns functions to the Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy to implement the policy. There is a mention of cooperation with foreign governments. There is nothing about immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document seems to promote federal coordination and planning in a specific area of research and development. It also explicitly states that the federal government should only undertake roles not more appropriately performed by the private sector, suggesting a limit to government intervention.
